arm_group.description: Patients, who were operated on because of pelvic organ prolapse.
Patients, who had hysterectomy due to other reasons than pelvic organ prolapse.

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of our study is to investigate the alterations in connective tissue of vaginal wall
      in patients with and without pelvic organ prolapse (POP).

clinical_study.brief_title: Alterations in Connective Tissue in Patients With or Without Pelvic Organ Prolapse

detailed_description.textblock:
The tissue samples were taken from the anterior wall of vagina in the midline close to
      cervix or apex. The tissue samples were collected from the vaginal wall of the patients with
      pelvic organ prolapse (n=39) during vaginal prolapse surgery.  Control samples (n=39) were
      taken from patients after vaginal or laparoscopic removal of the uterus.

      The formalin-fixed and paraffin embedded tissue samples were stained with Verhoeff van
      Gieson and Movat's pentachrome. Samples were examined by pathologist and gynecologist
      blinded as to the other investigator and to the pelvic organ prolapse status. In case of
      discrepancy investigators evaluated the samples together to gain consensus.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  surgery for pelvic organ prolapse

          -  hysterectomy due to other benign reasons than pelvic organ prolapse

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  surgery due to malignancy

study_pop.textblock: 39 patients with pelvic organ prolapse and as controls 39 patients without prolapse.

facility.name: Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology, Turku University Central Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Alterations in Connective Tissue in Patients With or Without Pelvic Organ Prolapse.

primary_outcome.measure: The elastin content in tissue samples in patients with or without pelvic organ prolapse.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: The collagen content in tissue samples in women with or without pelvic organ prolapse.
